Binomial Distribution

Source: R/SDistribution_Binomial.R
Binomial.Rd

Mathematical and statistical functions for the Binomial distribution parameterised with size (number of trials) and prob or \(qprob = 1 - prob\). The size-prob Binomial distribution is defined by the pmf, $$f(x) = C(n, x)p^x(1-p)^(n-x)$$ where \(n = 0,1,2,\ldots\) is the size parameter, \(p \epsilon [0,1]\) is the prob parameter and \(C(a,b)\) is the combination (or binomial coefficient) function.

Details

The default parameterisation of number of trials and probability of success is favoured over the probability of failure as talking in terms of failures is more commonly associated with the negative binomial distribution.

Constructor

Binomial$new(size = 10, prob = 0.5, decorators = NULL, verbose = FALSE)

Constructor Arguments

ArgumentTypeDetails
sizenumericnumber of trials.
probnumericprobability of success.
qprobnumericprobability of failure.
decoratorsDecoratordecorators to add functionality.
verboselogicalif TRUE parameterisation messages produced.

Constructor Details

The Binomial distribution is parameterised with size (number of trials) as an integer and either prob (probability of success) or qprob (probability of failure) as a number between 0 and 1. If qprob is given then prob is ignored.

Public Variables

MethodReturn
nameName of distribution.
short_nameId of distribution.
descriptionBrief description of distribution.
traitsList: type, valueSupport, variateForm.
packageThe package p/d/q/r are implemented in.
